intro: Campylandra urotepala, commonly known as the narrow-leafed campylandra, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
